cobblemon.species.pinkbutterfree.name: Butterfree
cobblemon.species.pinkbutterfree.desc1: The pink butterfree Ash's butterfree fell in love with, wearing Ash's Butterfree's scarf.
cobblemon.species.drakeon.name: Drakeon
cobblemon.species.silkeon.name: Silkeon
cobblemon.species.ireon.name: Ireon
cobblemon.species.ecteon.name: Ecteon
cobblemon.species.quareon.name: Quareon
cobblemon.species.soareon.name: Soareon
cobblemon.species.terreon.name: Terreon
cobblemon.species.sereneon.name: Sereneon
cobblemon.species.rowdeon.name: Rowdeon
cobblemon.species.toxeon.name: Toxeon
cobblemon.species.drakeon.desc: It is an incredibly loyal companion, also being very possessive of its owner much like dragons of folktale with their treasure.
cobblemon.species.silkeon.desc: It likes to rest in high grass, often napping in the shade during the day and traveling through the night.
cobblemon.species.ireon.desc: It is a ferocious and angry warrior. It charges at its enemies with the intent to win with vigor in its eyes.
cobblemon.species.ecteon.desc: It is often lost in thought. Many speculate that it is trying to recall its memories from before it evolved.
cobblemon.species.quareon.desc: It enjoys living around stalagmites and stalactites, where it can comfortably blend into its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.soareon.desc: It loves high altitudes and strong winds, appearing as though it imagined it could fly.
cobblemon.species.terreon.desc: It will dig holes just big enough to lay in, covering itself with its tail.
cobblemon.species.sereneon.desc: It evolves due to the stablization of its DNA. It was only recently discovered due to how uncommonly it occurs.
cobblemon.species.rowdeon.desc: It evolves due to the stablization of its DNA. It was recently discovered along with its normal type counterpart.
cobblemon.species.toxeon.desc: It can accurately detect poisons that are even usually undetectable, which it enjoys eating as though it were a delicacy.
cobblemon.species.rosebulbasaur.name: Bulbasaur
cobblemon.species.deleaf.name: Deleaf
cobblemon.species.deleaf.desc: They are small Pokémon that live in clearings, are sweet and run away from humans, as they are constantly hunted.
cobblemon.species.treashrub.name: Treashrub
cobblemon.species.treashrub.desc: live camouflaged among bushes, if they see a predator coming towards them, they prepare to attack first.
cobblemon.species.flareily.name: Flareily
cobblemon.species.flareily.desc: They are friendly pokemon and like to be in the presence of humans, their cheeks heat up as they feel happy.
cobblemon.species.ignefox.name: Ignefox
cobblemon.species.ignefox.desc: have great magical power, their tail is made of fur as hot as fire. The twig they carry is a catalyst for their movements.
cobblemon.species.jellynit.name: Jellynit
cobblemon.species.jellynit.desc: A young Pokémon who lives by the seaside lake likes to swim in the water and can walk, but if they stay away from the water for too long, they will become weak.
cobblemon.species.medutox.name: Medutox
cobblemon.species.medutox.desc: Growing forelimbs, able to move on land, although slower, able to move very quickly in water.
cobblemon.species.abyssringe.name: Abyssringe
cobblemon.species.snailistea.name: snailistea
cobblemon.species.shelteageist.name: shelteageist
cobblemon.species.snijumrat.name: Snijurat
cobblemon.species.larvescen.name: larvescen
cobblemon.species.lumarona.name: lumarona
cobblemon.species.cariolus.name: Cariolus
cobblemon.species.wildburning.name: Wild burning
cobblemon.species.roughbyte.name: Rough byte
cobblemon.species.irontorpedo.name: Iron torpedo
cobblemon.species.ironblawing.name: Iron Blawing
cobblemon.species.ludikappa.name: Ludikappa
cobblemon.species.ludikappa.desc1: Ludikappa lure travellers deep into bogs with the sweet scent of the flower on its head. When its prey gets too close to the water it drags them down into the deep, never to be seen again. The flower on its head makes a smell so pleasent it is said no one can resist its aroma. For this reason many perfumes use this flower as a part of their recipes.
cobblemon.species.lupayena.name: Lupayena
cobblemon.species.lupayena.desc1: Lupayena lead clans of Mightyena and Poochyena. They are kind souls, letting the Poochyena in the clan eat food first so they don't have to compete with the older members of the group.
cobblemon.species.linub.name: Linub
cobblemon.species.linub.desc1: Linub love to gather in big clumps in people's homes and roll around in massive balls, growing in size as they picking up dust particles and other Linub. While Linub tend to burrow through walls in the houses they live in, many homeowners choose to keep Linub that are in their home because of how cute they are.
cobblemon.species.pilolint.name: Pilolint
cobblemon.species.pilolint.desc1: Pilolint are so fuzzy they pick up clumps of dust as they walk around. They would actually do prety well at cleaning houses if they didn't attack anyone who tried to clean the dust off of them. Sometimes Pilolint let Linub hide inside of their coat for protection and warmth.
cobblemon.species.mamolint.name: Mamolint
cobblemon.species.mamolint.desc1: Mamolint pick up clumps of dust on their face, resembling a beard. The Mamolint with the biggest dust beards have the highest social status. Mamolint carry groups of Pilolint and Linub inside their mass of fur to protect them.
cobblemon.species.shucklegalar.desc1: This form of Shuckle is incredibly different from the more common form seen in most parts of the world. Instead of having a hard shell, its shell is made out of brittle ice but it can extend a massive appendage resembling a snowball cannon from its shell to fight predators.
cobblemon.species.heracrosspaldea.desc1: This form of Heracross is very docile and friendly to other pokemon. They like eating acorns and other tree nuts.
cobblemon.move.thunderclap.desc: This move enables the user to attack first with a jolt of electricity. This move fails if the target is not readying an attack.
cobblemon.ability.parentalbond.desc: These Pokémon work together to attack twice with the same move.
advancements.cobblemon.catch_starlit_viv: Use a Nether Star on a Spewpa at midnight to get the rare Starlit Pattern Vivillon and think about what you just did again.
cobblemon.species.stellotl.name: Stellotl
cobblemon.species.stellotl.desc1: Stellotl was supposedly born in the deepest part of the cosmos: The center of the Universe. It bathed in the purest starlight and carried on the celestial bodies' wishes to enlighten the world with its vast endless amount of light energy it stores in its small body. The life cycle of Stellotl is endless. If it may perish, it simply reverts to a §6smaller, §6more §6compact §6form, having to regain its lost power once more from the stars it originally got it from.
cobblemon.species.stellotlawakened.desc: Once it reunites with the starlight it lost a long time ago, Stellotl is able to take its true appearance again. Aeons ago it warded over the dreams of people and Pokémon alike high up in the night sky and flies across the globe in the speed of light. Ancient civilizations worshipped it as a deity of dreams and said, that when you encountered it during a starry night, your deepest of dreams will become reality.
cobblemon.species.stellumbra.name: Stellumbra
cobblemon.species.stellumbra.desc1: Together with its sibling Stellotl it used to guard over the dreams of people and Pokémon alike. A tragic incident caused it to lose all of its power and trust into humanity. With its psychic abilities Stellumbra is able to read their opponent's mind and unveil their darkest of desires. It will do anything to prevent that someone will ever fulfill their harmful dream.
cobblemon.species.infastella.name: Infastella
cobblemon.species.infastella.desc1: So far this is the only of two recorded specimen of its kind. Infastella seems to have originated from the deepest parts of the cosmos. Despite being extraterrestrial, its behavior seems to be that of a small child. It can vary from being playful, shy and spends most of its time sleeping. If it's plagued by a nightmare, it will wail so loud, it feels like it's ripping the fabric of reality itself apart and can only be calmed when being near a human it truly trusts.
cobblemon.species.equelpi.name: Equelpi
cobblemon.species.equelpi.desc1: Many are in disbelief to see this strange hybrid of a Pokémon. Equelpi, despite its strange looks, is a very shy and gentle Pokémon that rather avoids conflict. It has a very calming aura when it's happy. A lot of people with overloading amounts of stress are prescribed to go visit an Equelpi farm to help reduce their stress.
cobblemon.species.equiross.name: Equiross
cobblemon.species.equiross.desc1: Their emotion-sensing powers seem to have drastically increased upon evolution. The horns that are now budding on its head act as some sort of radar. Now that it's able to reveal the true intentions and emotions behind its opponents with ease, Equiross tries to show as little emotion as possible to conceal its own weaknesses the best it can. If taken care of well, very rarely Equiross will accidentally fall out of character and you can see it smile, just for a second.
cobblemon.species.equirin.name: Equirin
cobblemon.species.equirin.desc1: Equirin are much calmer and more collected than their impetuous younger form. With Tatsugiri it's one of the smartest dragon types known to date. In the wild spotting an Equirin is very rare and can be considered a lucky omen as they are able to sense anyone's presence in a 14 meter radius around them and flee immediately if they sense a soul with ill intentions. They nurture their young near or on top of a lake as they have the ability to walk on Water. Equirin are commonly known as the embodiment of peace, but when left with no choice, Equirin unleashes its full might to ensure its target is neutralized and no longer a harm to it or its trainer.
cobblemon.species.emberam.name: Emberam
cobblemon.species.emberam.desc1: Emberam are very playful Pokémon and love to headbutt each other. Whenever their golden horns ram into another, they emit a loud metallic clang that can be heard from miles away. If an Emberam bumps you with its head, then this Emberam trusts you and likes you very much.
cobblemon.species.aurnaram.name: Aurnaram
cobblemon.species.aurnaram.desc1: Upon evolution Emberam's precious golden fur became even more pristine and hardened like an armor. Aurnaram loves to show off its fruit of labor, the golden ornaments it forged during countless days of training and they are extremely proud of it. So proud, that all of the other Pokémon around it get annoyed of it, but Aurnaram doesn't quite care. It NEEDS to show off. They act like nobility around others. The golden gloves it created are extremely durable and pack quite the punch, but Aurnaram considers itself too good to use them in fear of damaging them. If you ever dare to try to touch its golden body parts, prepare yourself to get headbutted.
cobblemon.species.furnauries.name: Furnauries
cobblemon.species.furnauries.desc1: Furnauries has learned to dedicate its amazing forging abilities fully to aid others. Its new and improved set of golden armor can withstand any attack coming up its way. Fables of long forgotten times tell the story of a single Furnauries that saved an entire city from a great demise. They have a strong sense for justice and have a quite literal heart of gold, despite their tough and mean looks. If there are any smaller Pokémon in trouble, it will always try to help it. It is no longer a coward that just wears its gold for show and has learned the true value of it at last.
cobblemon.species.tigriff.name: Tigriff
cobblemon.species.tigriff.desc1: This ancient species of Pokémon is thought to be the reincarnated form of a forgotten dinosaur Pokémon. Tigriff are very lively and overly protective of their trainers. Caring for one requires a lot of love and care.
cobblemon.species.griffern.name: Griffern
cobblemon.species.griffern.desc1: Griffern is a very stoic Pokémon. It itself believes it is the best guardian to its trainer and other Pokémon there is. Dashing right into the scene whenever someone is in trouble, Griffern will not hesitate to use its sharp beak, claws or the hardened bud on the tip of its tail as a whip and do whatever is necessary to preserve everyone's safety. Griffern tend to overreact a lot, interpreting the smallest things danger and trying to save someone from something unharmful. Whenever it realises its mistake, it gets very embarassed and hides its face under its talons. Many people think the look of an embarassed Griffern is utterly adorable.
cobblemon.species.griffaera.name: Griffaera
cobblemon.species.griffaera.desc1: Legends say Griffaera is the reincarnation of several different souls that lead to its strange yet majestic appearance. Griffaera's flower crest emits a sweet scent that is said to appease even the most angry targets, lulling them into safety before giving them the finishing blow with its fatal stinger on the tip of its tail. The toxins its tail emits can either be healing or extremely poisonous, all depending on how Griffaera wants it to be.
cobblemon.species.quantom.name: Quantom
cobblemon.species.quantom.desc1: Quantom are very commonly found in the Lumora Region, but despite their small size they cause a lot of trouble. They are naturally very curious and are dedicated to experiment on the limits of their 9 lives and thus getting in a lot of extremely dangerous situations.
cobblemon.species.phantasmau.name: Phantasmau
cobblemon.species.phantasmau.desc1: A strong bond to its trainer made it refuse to perish. After its 9th life should have come to an end, Quantom awakened supernatural powers, causing it to be stuck between a state of being alive and dead at the same time. Not even scientist are quite sure how exactly it does that. Phantasmau are lot more cautious than their former selves out of fear that this state they are in is not permanent, yet they enjoy every extra minute they have gotten in their new semi-afterlife.
cobblemon.species.bronzombro.name: Bronzombro
cobblemon.species.bronzombro.desc: The smallest evolution to Gimmighoul with the least amount of coins, Bronzombro, seems to be the happiest one of the bunch as well. They often wander ruins, cities and forests looking for spare change to eat. Their life is very simple coded: It merely consists of eating coins and sleeping.
cobblemon.species.fluffle.name: Fluffle
cobblemon.species.fluffle.desc: For an odd reason these Pokémon evolved to look like Shuckle and have been first spotted in the Lumora Region. Their white fluffy fur is extremely dense and slows down Fluffle immensely, but it serves a lot of purposes: Berry storage, a warm and cozy blanket when sleeping and of course, a high defense. When sleeping, these Pokémon gather and all curl up into something resembling a huge ball of fluff.
cobblemon.species.mariroyal.name: Mariroyal
cobblemon.species.mariroyal.desc: You expected to find some cool lore on an unreleased Mon yet, huh? Well... TOO BAD!!
cobblemon.move.hyperstellarburst.desc: An energy explosion of pure cosmic power is fired at the target. Even if the target protects itself, the sheer force of the move still deals damage with half of its original strength.
cobblemon.move.hyperstellarstrike.desc: The user suddenly teleports behind the target and strikes it unexpectedly from behind with a mighty blow of dark stellar energy. Even when the target protects itself, this move will still be able to damage it with half of its original strength.
cobblemon.move.miraclemist.desc: The user rapidly emits a haze of wonderous mist at all of its opponents, utilizing the haze and having a chance to raise its speed.
cobblemon.move.chimeracraze.desc: The user attacks the target outrageously with all of its sharp limbs, draining its life force and breaking any barrier in its way.
cobblemon.move.forgingram.desc: The user charges at the target with full force in an attempt to ram it with its blazing horns. This might burn the target or lower its defense.
cobblemon.move.cataclym.desc: The user strikes its target with an ominous claw from the world of the undead, causing it to not be able to heal from any source for 3 turns
cobblemon.move.mochimania.desc: The user forms a ball of edible mochi dough and hurls it at the target. If used on an ally, this move heals them by 50% of their maximum HP
cobblemon.ability.wardingcompass.desc: This Pokémon always redirects enemy hits to towards it.
cobblemon.ability.celestialbody.desc: Increases the power of supereffective attacks, while weakening supereffective attacks directed towards it.
cobblemon.ability.voidlock.desc: This Pokémon sets up gravity upon entry.
cobblemon.ability.topnotcharmor.desc: This Pokémon is immune to Fire type attacks thanks to its enchanted armor. When hit by one, it raises its fighting spirit and with this its Attack.
cobblemon.ability.truecolors.desc: Always changes the type of the last used move.
cobblemon.species.klink_cheseian.desc: Ancient machinery powered by wooden gears and copper bearings, it moves slowly but builds up immense power over time. Its creaking joints echo through dense forests.
cobblemon.species.klang_cheseian.desc: With more intricate copper mechanisms, it grinds forward methodically, unleashing devastating energy bursts. Its wooden components resonate with the rustling of leaves.
cobblemon.species.klinklang_cheseian.des: Fully synchronized wooden gears and reinforced Copper Beryllium plating make it an impenetrable fortress. It charges slowly but can unleash catastrophic blasts once fully wound.
cobblemon.species.rapidash_cheseian.desc: An ironclad Rapidash returning from the battlefield. From a time, long ago
cobblemon.species.hunterror.name: Hunterror
cobblemon.species.hunterror.desc: Lives deep in oceans, it feasts on wanderng a Magikarp
cobblemon.species.hunterror-pink.desc: Hunterror with a rare color mutation, female trainers seem to really like these for some reason
cobblemon.species.taikoch.name: Taikoch
cobblemon.species.taikoch.desc1: The ear-like membranes on Taikoch’s arms are used to amplify its sound. When it beats on its drum, it boosts the fighting spirit of itself and others.
cobblemon.species.taikoch.desc2: When it signals a fight, its pounding can be heard from incredibly far away.
cobblemon.species.maractaya.name: Maractaya
cobblemon.species.maractaya.desc1: When Maractus’s flowers bore fruit during evolution, this Pokémon was filled with a rage that had lay dormant.
cobblemon.species.maractaya.desc2: It dances vigorously to intimidate others, but many trainers find it cute instead.
cobblemon.species.terrasilisk.name: Terrasilisk
cobblemon.species.terrasilisk.desc1: This cantankerous pokemon loves ramming head first into anything and anyone in its territory.
cobblemon.species.terrasilisk.desc2: It’s body is covered head-to-toe in hardened scales. When it's scales were analyzed by scientists, they were unable to distinguish it molecularly from grains of sand.
cobblemon.species.suikani.name: Suikani
cobblemon.species.suikani.desc1: At certain times of the year, hordes of Suikani can be seen floating down rivers and streams.
cobblemon.species.suikani.desc2: It has a friendly disposition. But if disturbed, it retreats into it's shell and becomes indistinguishable from an ordinary melon.
cobblemon.form.koffing-goombian.name: Koffing
cobblemon.form.koffing-goombian.desc1: A rare form of Koffing that exists in only the coldest of climates.
cobblemon.form.koffing-goombian.desc2: It builds a strong tolerance against the bitter cold.
cobblemon.species.sneezing.name: Sneezing
cobblemon.species.sneezing.desc1: This Pokemon gently floats into towns and cities during winter.
cobblemon.species.sneezing.desc2: It lingers for only a moment before flying away, but it’s enough to make nearly everyone who was near it sick.
cobblemon.species.masticat.name: Masticat
cobblemon.species.masticat.desc1: It bites anything it pleases, even people who wander too deep into its forest.
cobblemon.species.masticat.desc2: This further strengthens its powerful jaws.
cobblemon.species.chewshire.name: Chewshire
cobblemon.species.chewshire.desc1: Its mouth is stuck in a perpetual grin due to its powerful jaw muscles.
cobblemon.species.chewshire.desc2: This grin encourages lost wanderers to follow it for guidance, but its enigmatic nature tends to get trainers even more lost than if they hadn’t followed it.
cobblemon.species.salamarine.name: Salamarine
cobblemon.species.salamarine.desc1: This Pokemon possesses an incredibly hot fire-spewing gland that launches streams of superheated oily fluid at enemies.
cobblemon.species.salamarine.desc2: This organ gets overheated easily, so it likes to spend all of its time swimming in cold oceans.
cobblemon.species.misteamie.name: Misteamie
cobblemon.species.misteamie.desc1: Omnicog undergoes a mysterious transformation when exposed to certain machinery, turning it into Misteamie.
cobblemon.species.misteamie.desc2: This good-natured Pokemon is known to traverse vast networks of railroads looking for smaller Pokemon to carry around on its back.
cobblemon.species.oremand.name: Oremand
cobblemon.species.oremand.desc1: When exposed to a certain device, Omnicog assembles itself into Oremand.
cobblemon.species.oremand.desc2: This temperamental Pokemon devastates tough rock with its heavy alloy crushers and eats the resulting gravel. It processes the ore it eats, becoming part of the highly valuable crystal atop its head.
cobblemon.species.omnicog.name: Omnicog
cobblemon.species.omnicog.desc1: Omnicog is known to gather loose components and assemble them onto itself.
cobblemon.species.omnicog.desc2: It likes to fit itself into machinery, becoming part of whatever mechanism it enters. It has the potential to turn into a diverse array of intricate machines.
cobblemon.species.ascrolyte.name: Ascrolyte
cobblemon.species.ascrolyte.desc1: This Pokemon lurks in ancient tombs, it does its best to keep these places tidy.
cobblemon.species.ascrolyte.desc2: It is known to guide adventurers with the plethora of information written inside of it.
cobblemon.species.flapestry.name: Flapestry
cobblemon.species.flapestry.desc1: Mysteriously, in the night, Flapestry are said to sweep the floors of their trainers’ homes, snacking on all the sand and dust it can find.
cobblemon.species.flapestry.desc2: In a heroic act of kindness, it will go out of its way to carry lost desert travelers to safety.
cobblemon.species.croppup.name: Croppup
cobblemon.species.croppup.desc1: According to legend, an old farmer discovered Croppup in his cabbage patch.
cobblemon.species.croppup.desc2: After the farmer raised it, he found that his other cabbages had nuggets of gold hidden within them.
cobblemon.species.magnipulo.name: Magnipulo
cobblemon.species.magnipulo.desc1: This nefarious Pokémon uses its absurdly long, string-like tentacles to make others do it’s own bidding. Every action this Pokémon makes is slow and deliberate, as if it is working towards some kind of grand plan.
cobblemon.species.magnipulo.desc2: Only once all of these plans have been foiled will Magnipulo resort to brutal strangulation.
cobblemon.species.cephalange.name: Cephalange
cobblemon.species.cephalange.desc1: The tips of Cephalange’s tentacles can change color and texture as desired.
cobblemon.species.cephalange.desc2: For some strange reason, Cephalange only uses this to mock the other Pokemon it lives with.
cobblemon.species.alpioca.name: Alpioca
cobblemon.species.alpioca.desc1: This Pokemon feeds on a certain root, it then turns it into a gummy substance that coats its body.
cobblemon.species.alpioca.desc2: It is very docile, allowing farmers to shear its milk foam fur for their confections.
cobblemon.species.pikapod.name: Pikapod
cobblemon.species.pikapod.desc1: Long ago, Pikapod was hunted to near extinction due to its dangerous electric shocks. Only those with a pattern that resembled Pikachu were spared for their cuteness.
cobblemon.species.pikapod.desc2: Today, it is virtually impossible to find a Pikapod without a Pikachu pattern. After years of hunting, it has adapted to be quite durable and use its squishy body to convert kinetic force into electrical energy.
cobblemon.species.wooper-kobellian.desc: The lush caves of the Kobel region allowed Wooper to adapt into a variety of dazzling colors. Now with a more moist and slimier body, they evade predators much easier than their Johtonian relatives.
cobblemon.species.pichu_oblivian.desc: This Pichu is a rare variant that comes from a land of legendary rangers. It uses it's special ukulele to send off electrified sound waves at it's opponents.
cobblemon.species.pitipole.name: Pitipole
cobblemon.species.pitipole.desc1: In its natural habitat, this pokémon desprately attempts to eat glow berries that hang just out of reach.
cobblemon.species.pitipole.desc2: It is mostly blind, and must curl its tail to create a paddle. It struggles even in its home territory.
cobblemon.species.tentaquil.name: Tentaquil
cobblemon.species.tentaquil.desc1: If its bold colors do not sufficiently ward off predators, it secretes toxins that smell strongly of copper.
cobblemon.species.tentaquil.desc2: There has only been one recorded sighting of this pokémon. Until recently, this was considered to be a joke.
cobblemon.species.cigarat.name: Cigarat
cobblemon.species.cigarat.desc1: Its prolonged exposure to its own heavily toxic smoke has darkened its fur.
cobblemon.species.cigarat.desc2: While in a pack, the darker one’s fur is, the more power it has. This fur is very flammable and releases noxious chemicals if burned.
cobblemon.species.smouse.name: Smouse
cobblemon.species.smouse.desc1: This Pokemon’s internal organs produce a fragrant yet harmful gas.
cobblemon.species.smouse.desc2: This gas contains particles that stain Smouse’s fur.
cobblemon.species.latot.name: Latot
cobblemon.species.latot.desc1: It loves soaring around flower fields at top speed. Latot is known to form a strong bond with its trainer.
cobblemon.species.raygul.name: Raygul
cobblemon.species.raygul.desc1: This Pokemon has been spotted playing amongst the clouds with other Flying types.
cobblemon.species.delcalf.name: Delcalf
cobblemon.species.xerfawn.name: Xerfawn
cobblemon.species.yangram.name: Yangram
cobblemon.species.creslume.name: Creslume
The flower it's holding can no longer be found blooming anywhere. It's also thought to contain terrifying power. Terrifying energy is concealed within its ominous flower, but Floette still swings it about innocently.
cobblemon.species.tyrarch.name: Tyrarch
cobblemon.species.tyrarch.desc: This Pokémon was artificially created for entertainment purposes. Even at their young age, Tyrarchs are known to possess long sharp claws and an strong bond to their trainers and packmates.
cobblemon.species.archerantrum.name: Archerantrum
cobblemon.species.archerantrum.desc: Archerantrum was created to be as strong like an Tyrantrum and as nimble as an Archeops, these are the perfect for battles. this ended up causing the banishment of all hybrids from official tournaments
cobblemon.species.leemaura.name: Leemaura
cobblemon.species.leemaura.desc: This Pokémon was artificially created for entertainment purposes. Leemauras are considered living freakshows to most people. To others they could be seen as exotic pets due to their quiet and reserved nature and an unusual appearance.
cobblemon.species.crinaurus.name: Crinaurus
cobblemon.species.crinaurus.desc: Crinaurus are higgly seeked after reserves like the Safari Zones since their bizarre looks and great size attracts visitors from all over the world.
cobblemon.species.tirtonidos.name: Tirtonidos
cobblemon.species.tirtonidos.desc: This Pokémon was artificially created for entertainment purposes. Tirtonidos are slow minded hybrids that were created to be higgly popular around trainers for being incredibly easy to train and to take care of.
cobblemon.species.ramcosta.name: Ramcosta
cobblemon.species.ramcosta.desc: Ramcosta are known for their higgly tough shell and to swing their mighty tails against opponents, owning one of them as an teamate is a dream of every young trainer.
cobblemon.species.pawleo.name: Pawleo
cobblemon.species.pawleo.desc: This Pokémon was artificially created for research purposes. Created with the extracted DNA of Eevees, Pawleo was made to have the same unstable genetic makeup that can cause it to evolve when exposed to certain types of fossilized Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.blazera.name: Blazera
cobblemon.species.blazera.desc: After being exposed to the Drake fossil, Pawleo will evolve into Blazera! Known for their short temper and large horns, they tend to reach 75 km/h when chasing prey on foot
cobblemon.species.oozera.name: Oozera
cobblemon.species.oozera.desc: After being exposed to the Dino fossil, Pawleo will evolve into Oozera! Oozeras are stealthy and clever hunters that like to stalk their prey, waiting for the perfect moment. The venom they spit is able to blind and paralyse prey.
cobblemon.species.glidera.name: Glidera
cobblemon.species.glidera.desc: After being exposed to the Bird fossil, Pawleo will evolve into Glidera! Its the most mammalian hybrid of Pawleo's evolutionary branch. They soar through the skies searching for prey from above with help of its sharp vision and hearing sences.
cobblemon.species.divera.name: Divera
cobblemon.species.divera.desc: After being exposed to the Fish fossil, Pawleo will evolve into Divera! Diveras are passive semi-aquatic Pokémon that are often observed swimming on vast water sources. It does not mind the pressence of most Pokémon in it's territory.
cobblemon.species.anobuto.name: Anobuto
cobblemon.species.anobuto.desc: This Pokémon was artificially created for entertainment purposes. In contrary of Kabuto and Anorith Anobuto actually prefers to live in the land then in the sea, because it's vision gets blurred underwater.
cobblemon.species.kabumaldo.name: Kabumaldo
cobblemon.species.kabumaldo.desc: Now higgly adapted for living in land, Kabumaldo is known to have sharp arm like mandibles that end in a scythe used to cut it's food in little pieces to fit it's small mouth.
cobblemon.species.shieldanyte.name: Shieldanyte
cobblemon.species.shieldanyte.desc: This Pokémon was artificially created for entertainment purposes. Being extremely shy Shieldanyte is allways hiding it's face with a mask-like extension of it's shell.
cobblemon.species.omastiodon.name: Omastiodon
cobblemon.species.omastiodon.desc: After evolving, the once small and shy Shieldanyte turns into an higgly territorial and agressive Pokémon called Omastiodon. Its protective shell can now split open into two halves, revealing it's real face.
cobblemon.species.mikueon.name: Mikueon
cobblemon.species.mikueon.desc: Its special voice is known to captivate both people and Pokemon who listen. It forms crowds of wild Pokemon who listen and sing wherever it resides.
cobblemon.species.tetoeon.name: Tetoeon
cobblemon.species.tetoeon.desc: It has a stange affinity for bread that none have been able to find a reason for. They are commonly found sneaking into village bakeries at night and leaving with loaves stuffed in their mouths.
cobblemon.species.nerueon.name: Nerueon
cobblemon.species.nerueon.desc: Short tempered; it dislikes being disturbed and will use its giant ear to smack those who get near. Its powerful voice can be used to create soothing melodies or violent screeches depending on its mood.
cobblemon.species.redpickmin.name: R. Pickmin
cobblemon.species.redpickmin.desc1: Red Pickmin are small, plant-like creatures known for their pointed noses and resistance to fire. Braver and stronger than other types, they are often found at the front lines in battle. Their bold color and aggressive nature make them ideal fighters in hazardous environments.
cobblemon.species.yellowpickmin.name: Y. Pickmin
cobblemon.species.yellowpickmin.desc1: Yellow Pickmin are lightweight and easily tossed to great heights. They have large ears and a natural resistance to electricity, allowing them to safely handle electric hazards. Their agility and affinity for high places make them perfect for reaching out-of-the-way areas and activating electrical circuits.
cobblemon.species.yellowpickmin.desc2: Stronger ones of this species are often found during a thunderstorm in the mountains.
cobblemon.species.bluepickmin.name: B. Pickmin
cobblemon.species.bluepickmin.desc1: Blue Pickmin are distinguished by their gill-like mouths, which allow them to breathe underwater. Calm and dependable, they excel in aquatic environments where other Pickmin would drown. Their ability to traverse and operate in water makes them essential for exploring submerged areas.
cobblemon.species.whitepickmin.name: W. Pickmin
cobblemon.species.whitepickmin.desc1: White Pickmin are small, fast, and have eerie red eyes. They can detect hidden treasures buried underground. Their speed and special abilities make them invaluable for scouting and treasure hunting.
cobblemon.species.whitepickmin.desc2: Stronger ones of this species are often found wandering Woodland Mansions.
cobblemon.species.purplepickmin.name: P. Pickmin
cobblemon.species.purplepickmin.desc1: Purple Pickmin are large and heavy, with a stocky build and surprising strength. Though slower than other types, they can carry ten times the weight of a regular Pickmin and stun enemies when thrown. Their brute force makes them ideal for lifting heavy objects and overpowering tough foes.
cobblemon.species.wingpickmin.name: Wing-Pickmin
cobblemon.species.wingpickmin.desc1: Winged Pickmin are light, pink, and equipped with delicate wings that allow them to hover and fly. They excel at carrying items over obstacles and can attack airborne enemies with ease. Though not very strong, their aerial mobility makes them essential for navigating tricky terrain and reaching isolated areas.
cobblemon.species.wingpickmin.desc2: Stronger ones of this species are often found wandering Cherry Groves.
cobblemon.species.icepickmin.name: Ice-Pickmin
cobblemon.species.icepickmin.desc1: Ice Pickmin are cool-toned creatures with frosty bodies and a chilling touch. They can freeze enemies solid, immobilizing threats and making them easier to defeat. While fragile in direct combat, their ability to disable foes makes them valuable for strategic encounters.
cobblemon.species.rockpickmin.name: Rock-Pickmin
cobblemon.species.rockpickmin.desc1: Rock Pickmin have tough, gemstone-like bodies that give them impressive durability. Rather than latching onto enemies, they strike with force, dealing heavy blunt damage. Immune to crushing and ideal for breaking hard barriers like glass or crystals, their strength makes them a key asset in any tough terrain.
cobblemon.species.bulbpickmin.name: Bulbmine
cobblemon.species.bulbpickmin.desc1: Bulbmine are parasitic Pickmin that inhabit the bodies of Bulbore hosts, giving them a fearsome, hybrid appearance. Resistant to fire, electricity, water, and poison, they are incredibly hardy and adaptable. Their eerie resilience and dragon-like tenacity make them powerful allies in the most hazardous environments.
cobblemon.species.glowpickmin.name: Glow-Pickmin
cobblemon.species.glowpickmin.desc1: Glow Pickmin are mysterious, luminous beings that only appear in the dark. Their ethereal glow confuses enemies, and they can phase through certain obstacles with ease. Immune to most hazards and fearless in nighttime conditions, their ghostly nature makes them ideal for exploring dangerous, shadowy areas.
cobblemon.species.necromarrow.name: Necromarrow
cobblemon.species.necromarrow.desc: Weilding the mystical power of the Twilight Lich's septer, this Pokémon can summon an undead army of its ancestors.
cobblemon.species.dwebble-twilight.desc: These Pokémon are thought to have derived from the Helmet Crab. Rather than use discarded helmets, this Pokémon has adapted to use the bricks of the stronghold.
cobblemon.species.crustle-twilight.desc: The Underbricks used for their shells are especially resilient against magic attacks. There have been rumors of some Crustle using Labyrinth Bricks to achieve an even stronger exterior.
cobblemon.species.wooloo-twilight.desc: Their technicolor wool shines a briliant blue in direct moonlight. Their natural enemy is Poochyena.
cobblemon.species.dubwool-twilight.desc: Their large horns and thick wool can protect them against most attacks. Even a fully grown Mightyena leave these Pokémon alone.
cobblemon.species.deerling-twilight.desc: Due to existing in a timeless realm, these Pokémon have incorporated all seasons into their pelt. This separation from time has led to them developing psychic abilities.
cobblemon.species.sawsbuck-twilight.desc: They possess the ability to manipulate time and accelerate crop growth. The clock on their chest is always synced to the Timewood Tree.
cobblemon.species.tropius-twilight.desc: Due to their diet of canopy tree leaves, these Pokémon are infused with the power of the Twilight Forest. Their immense size and incredible power makes them an absolute powerhouse that is unrivaled by any other Pokémon in the whole dimension.
cobblemon.species.paras-twilight.desc: These Pokémon engage in brood parasitism with Slime Beetles. Once they outcompete the Slime Beetle's young, they will abandon their host to develop the slime on their backs.
cobblemon.species.parasect-twilight.desc: These Pokémon have formed a symbiotic relationship with a sentient slime. The slime protects Parasect in exchange for nutrients.
cobblemon.species.ekans-twilight.desc: They dredge the Naga Courtyard for shed Naga scales. Once found, they will consume the scales to incorporate into their own hide.
cobblemon.species.arbok-twilight.desc: This Pokémon has adapted to mimic the Naga's face on their chest. They use this to ward off trespassers of the Naga Courtyard.
cobblemon.species.ralts-twilight.desc: Unlike normal Ralts, these forms are very reckless. They will pick fights with Pokémon several times their size.
cobblemon.species.kirlia-twilight.desc: Now big enough to wear armor, Kirlias will roam the Dark Forest in search of opponents to hone their fighting skills.
cobblemon.species.gardevoir-twilight.des: When a queen is defeated in battle, one female Kirlia is chosen to evolve into Gardevoir. They will become the new leaders of the stronghold, marking the ''dawn'' of a new dynasty.
cobblemon.species.gallade-twilight.desc: They are fierce warriors that will defend their queen to no end. Both male and female Kirlia become Gallade to fulfill their knightly duties.
cobblemon.species.golett-twilight.desc: Fueled by a block of Carminite, these Pokémon can emit intense electrical charges. They are surprisingly flame-resistant despite their wooden bodies.
cobblemon.species.golurk-twilight.desc: These Pokémon were forged in ancient times by an unknown civilization. Researchers believe these Pokémon were invented to protect the Dark Tower.
cobblemon.species.venipede-twilight.desc: Adherents have bred these creatures for war for generations. Even their larvae are barbaric in nature.
cobblemon.species.whirlipede-twilight.de: These Pokémon have an extremely tough yet flexible hide. They spin at incredible speeds to slam into walls, breaching enemy defences.
cobblemon.species.scolipede-twilight.des: Adherents ride these Pokémon into battle. A legion of these beasts can completely destroy an entire ecosystem in minutes.
cobblemon.species.cubone-twilight.desc: These Pokémon are seen as pets by the skeleton druids. They are fiercely loyal to their masters, but will flee when confronted with danger.
cobblemon.species.marowak-twilight.desc: They carry a magical golden hoe capable of unleashing powerful attacks. Some say that these hoes were forged by a long-lost race of powerful druids.
cobblemon.species.aron-twilight.desc: This Pokémon's diet consists of living root and various ores. It uses this to create a special alloy that protects its body.
cobblemon.species.lairon-twilight.desc: Their armor has the incredible ability to regenerate. Despite this, Lairon will intentionally keep their scars to show off their fighting prowess.
cobblemon.species.aggron-twilight.desc: It dwells deep within the caves of the Twilight Highlands. It mercilessly thrashes those that attempt to loot the giant obsidian cube in the center.
cobblemon.species.fidough-twilight.desc: Also known as Experiment-116, this Pokémon is a failed attempt to create self-regenerating cake. No one is sure if the dark red underbelly is cake or flesh...
cobblemon.species.dachsbun-twilight.desc: Scientists have conducted various experiments to uncover what this Pokémon's flesh is comprised of. From these experiments, they have discovered that this Pokémon can fully regenerate their bodies when exposed to an electrical current.
cobblemon.species.nickit-twilight.desc: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from Mist Wolves.
cobblemon.species.thievul-twilight.desc: Their translucent bodies allow them to hunt without being detected. Despite this advantage, most of their meals are stolen from Mist Wolf packs.
cobblemon.species.tangela-twilight.desc: This Pokémon is covered in razor-sharp spines. Their vines can instantly regenerate from almost any attack.
cobblemon.species.tangrowth-twilight.des: They have an intense urge to protect the Final Castle. Even their young instinctually obstruct anyone attempting to pass through the Thornlands.
cobblemon.species.deino-twilight.desc: Unlike normal Deino, these Pokémon are very timid. They often isolate themselves from their mothers due to feeling overshadowed by their siblings.
cobblemon.species.zweilous-twilight.desc: Their two heads can often be seen squabbling with one another. This is not fighting, but a polite discussion on hot topics.
cobblemon.species.hydreigon-twilight.des: It is said that the Hydra was once a Hydreigon that consumed everything in its wake to become the largest creature in the Twilight Forest. This is a rare case though, as most Hydreigon are very agreeable creatures.
cobblemon.species.pinsir-twilight.desc: Larger and stronger than normal Pinsir, these Pokémon latch onto prey with tenacious strength. Their strong jaws can crack bones with ease.
cobblemon.species.drifloon-twilight.desc: It captures weary adventurers and brings them to the Dark Tower where they are never seen again.
cobblemon.species.drifblim-twilight.desc: This Pokémon can shoot fireballs that explode on impact. Some say these projectiles are fueled by the fiery souls of the damned.
cobblemon.species.heracross-twilight.des: This Pokémon fires a steady stream of flames from their horns. When threatened, these flames will shoot more violently and burn a bright blue.
cobblemon.species.vivillon-twilight.desc: Glowing butterfly,                                 Forever cradled in dusk,                           Timeless wings take flight.
cobblemon.species.miltank-mooshtank.name: Mooshtank
cobblemon.species.mooshtank.desc: Twilight Miltank, or Mooshtank, live in the dank fungal areas of the Twilight Labyrinth. Despite their resemblance, these Pokémon do not share genetics or allegiance with the fearsome Minoshroom. Some scientists speculate this is a case of convergent evolution, while others believe this happens to all bovine creatures that spend enough time in these tunnels. In any case, Mooshtank are wonderful companions that can provide tasty mushroom stew in a pinch.
cobblemon.species.shadows.desc: The Adherents have been conducting secret experiments deep within the walls of the Final Castle. Infused with shadow energy, these Pokémon forms are incredibly powerful and merciless. Even the juveniles can take down their normal adult counterparts with ease. Proceed with extreme caution...
cobblemon.species.sculkie.name: Sculkie
cobblemon.species.shriekumo.name: Shriekumo
cobblemon.species.echolossus.name: Echolossus
